page.title: 12CHILDSWICKHAM VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The village hall in Childswickham is now the focal point of the village. About sixty years ago a barn was purchased with a committee acting as trustees, each lending 10. The barn was rebuilt and the money soon repaid from fund raising activities such as Saturday night dances with a local three piece band, admission being sixpence. Later old time dances were run on Friday nights, one shilling for admission. After the 1939-1945 war the hall was renovated and plaques erected in memory of those who had died. It was renamed the Memorial Hall. An excellent snooker table was purchased which is very much used by local and outside players. The Womens Institute, Evergreens and Young Wives group meet in the hall, other activities include Bingo, Whist Drives, Suppers and Wine and Cheese evenings.
